column4: I am following this post http://www.webupd8.org/2010/10/install-gnome-shell-from-git-in-ubuntu.html to install the latest version of gnome 3 and I got the "possible error #2 "
and when git clone git://git.gnome.org/libnotify  I get fatal: destination path 'libnotify' already exists and is not an empty directory.
how can I fix that and move on ??
why are you doing this ?
it makes your machine totally impossible to support
I am curious to try it out
it's not something you can "try" it won't be possible to undo it very easy and will make your machine totally impossible to support
plus it really sounds like you don't know what you're doing and just typing commands blindly
I can always reverse it
how ?
it's installed into a folder I suppose and doesnt affect your currrent config..
does it not change any of the dependencies on your system
I dont know where I read that...I am not sure...
help me go through that and we'll see :D
no thanks,
you're adding 3rd party repos to update the deps and then building it into your home directory, it's not something I'd recommend
hm...but what can I do with fatal: destination path 'libnotify' already exists and is not an empty directory.
I'm not supporting this, I suggest you contact the person/team who wrote the guide
no cp will backup
mv will move
mv will rename
